trans-unit.source: Encapsulates a GDI+ bitmap, which consists of the pixel data for a graphics image and its attributes.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> is an object used to work with images defined by pixel data.
A bitmap consists of the pixel data for a graphics image and its attributes.
There are many standard formats for saving a bitmap to a file.
[!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)] supports the following file formats: BMP, GIF, EXIF, JPG, PNG and TIFF.
For more information about supported formats, see [Types of Bitmaps](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/types-of-bitmaps.md).

You can create images from files, streams, and other sources by using one of the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.%23ctor%2A> constructors and save them to a stream or to the file system with the <xref:System.Drawing.Image.Save%2A> method.
Images are drawn to the screen or to memory by using the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.DrawImage%2A> method of the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object.
For a list of topics about working with image files, see [Working with Images, Bitmaps, Icons, and Metafiles](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/working-with-images-bitmaps-icons-and-metafiles.md).
The <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap> class is not accessible across application domains.

For example, if you create a dynamic <xref:System.AppDomain> and create several brushes, pens, and bitmaps in that domain, then pass these objects back to the main application domain, you can successfully use the pens and brushes.
However, if you call the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.DrawImage%2A> method to draw the marshaled <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap>, you receive the following exception.
Remoting cannot find field "native image" on type "System.Drawing.Image".
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class from the specified existing image.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> from which to create the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class from the specified data stream.
You must keep the stream open for the lifetime of the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap>.

Due to a limitation of the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)] decoder, an <xref:System.ArgumentException?displayProperty=fullName> is thrown if you construct a bitmap from a .png image file with a single dimension greater than 65,535 pixels.
The data stream used to load the image.
stream does not contain image data or is `null`.
-or-
stream contains a PNG image file with a single dimension greater than 65,535 pixels.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class from the specified file.
The file name and path can be relative to the application or an absolute path.
Use this constructor to open images with the following file formats: BMP, GIF, EXIF, JPG, PNG and TIFF.
For more information about supported formats, see [Types of Bitmaps](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/types-of-bitmaps.md).
The file remains locked until the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap> is disposed.
The bitmap file name and path.
The specified file is not found.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class from the specified existing image, scaled to the specified size.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> from which to create the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> structure that represent the size of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The operation failed.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class with the specified size.
This constructor creates a <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap> with a <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat> enumeration value of <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format32bppArgb>.
The width, in pixels, of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The height, in pixels, of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The operation failed.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class from the specified data stream.
You must keep the stream open for the lifetime of the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap>.

Due to a limitation of the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)] decoder, an <xref:System.ArgumentException?displayProperty=fullName> is thrown if you construct a bitmap from a .png image file with a single dimension greater than 65,535 pixels.
The data stream used to load the image.
`true` to use color correction for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
stream does not contain image data or is `null`.
-or-
stream contains a PNG image file with a single dimension greater than 65,535 pixels.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class from the specified file.
Use this constructor to open images with the following file formats: BMP, GIF, EXIF, JPG, PNG and TIFF.
For more information about supported formats, see [Types of Bitmaps](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/types-of-bitmaps.md).
The file remains locked until the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap> is disposed.
The name of the bitmap file.
`true` to use color correction for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class from a specified resource.
This constructor combines the namespace of the given type with the string name of the resource and looks for a match in the assembly manifest.
For example you can pass in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> type and `Button.bmp` to this constructor and it will look for a resource named `System.Windows.Forms.Button.bmp`.
The class used to extract the resource.
The name of the resource.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class from the specified existing image, scaled to the specified size.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> from which to create the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The width, in pixels, of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The height, in pixels, of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The operation failed.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class with the specified size and with the resolution of the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> object.

The new <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap> that this method creates takes its horizontal and vertical resolution from the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.DpiX%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.DpiY%2A> properties of `g`, respectively.
The width, in pixels, of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The height, in pixels, of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> object that specifies the resolution for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
g is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class with the specified size and format.
The width, in pixels, of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The height, in pixels, of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The pixel format for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
This must specify a value that begins with Format.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> value is specified whose name does not start with *Format*.

For example, specifying <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Gdi"></xref> will cause an <xref href="System.ArgumentException"></xref>, but <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format48bppRgb"></xref> will not.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> class with the specified size, pixel format, and pixel data.
The caller is responsible for allocating and freeing the block of memory specified by the `scan0` parameter.
However, the memory should not be released until the related <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap> is released.
The width, in pixels, of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The height, in pixels, of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
Integer that specifies the byte offset between the beginning of one scan line and the next.
This is usually (but not necessarily) the number of bytes in the pixel format (for example, 2 for 16 bits per pixel) multiplied by the width of the bitmap.
The value passed to this parameter must be a multiple of four..
The pixel format for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
This must specify a value that begins with Format.
Pointer to an array of bytes that contains the pixel data.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> value is specified whose name does not start with *Format*.

For example, specifying <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Gdi"></xref> will cause an <xref href="System.ArgumentException"></xref>, but <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format48bppRgb"></xref> will not.
Creates a copy of the section of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> defined with a specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> enumeration.
Defines the portion of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> to copy.
Specifies the <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> enumeration for the destination <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> that this method creates.
rect is outside of the source bitmap bounds.
The height or width of rect is 0.

Creates a copy of the section of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> defined by <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure and with a specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> enumeration.
Defines the portion of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> to copy.
Coordinates are relative to this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The pixel format for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
This must specify a value that begins with Format.
The new <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> that this method creates.
rect is outside of the source bitmap bounds.
The height or width of rect is 0.
-or-
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> value is specified whose name does not start with *Format*.

For example, specifying <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Gdi"></xref> will cause an <xref href="System.ArgumentException"></xref>, but <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format48bppRgb"></xref> will not.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> from a Windows handle to an icon.
A handle to an icon.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> that this method creates.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> from the specified Windows resource.
<xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.FromResource%2A> requires security permission to call unmanaged code.
For a managed alternative for creating a bitmap from an embedded resource, see <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.%23ctor%28System.Type%2CSystem.String%29?displayProperty=fullName>.
<xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.FromResource%2A> works only with bitmaps that are named resources in a DLL.
A handle to an instance of the executable file that contains the resource.
A string that contains the name of the resource bitmap.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> that this method creates.
Creates a [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] bitmap object from this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.

You are responsible for calling the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] `DeleteObject` method to free the memory used by the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] bitmap object.
For more information about GDI bitmaps, see [Bitmaps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=205685) in the Windows GDI documentation.
A handle to the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] bitmap object that this method creates.
The height or width of the bitmap is greater than <xref href="System.Int16.MaxValue"></xref>.
The operation failed.
Creates a [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] bitmap object from this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.

You are responsible for calling the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] `DeleteObject` method to free the memory used by the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] bitmap object.
For more information about GDI bitmaps, see [Bitmaps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=205685) in the Windows GDI documentation.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure that specifies the background color.
This parameter is ignored if the bitmap is totally opaque.
A handle to the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] bitmap object that this method creates.
The height or width of the bitmap is greater than <xref href="System.Int16.MaxValue"></xref>.
The operation failed.
Returns the handle to an icon.
Initially, an icon created from the handle will have the same size as the original bitmap.
A Windows handle to an icon with the same image as the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The operation failed.
Gets the color of the specified pixel in this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The x-coordinate of the pixel to retrieve.
The y-coordinate of the pixel to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure that represents the color of the specified pixel.
x is less than 0, or greater than or equal to .
-or-
y is less than 0, or greater than or equal to .
The operation failed.
Locks a <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> into system memory.
Use the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.LockBits%2A> method to lock an existing bitmap in system memory so that it can be changed programmatically.

You can change the color of an image with the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.SetPixel%2A> method, although the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.LockBits%2A> method offers better performance for large-scale changes.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData> specifies the attributes of the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap>, such as size, pixel format, the starting address of the pixel data in memory, and length of each scan line (stride).
When calling this method, you should use a member of the <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat?displayProperty=fullName> enumeration that contains a specific bits-per-pixel (BPP) value.

Using <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat?displayProperty=fullName> values such as <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Indexed> and <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Gdi> will throw an <xref:System.ArgumentException?displayProperty=fullName>.
Also, passing the incorrect pixel format for a bitmap will throw an <xref:System.ArgumentException?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure that specifies the portion of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> to lock.
An <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageLockMode"></xref> enumeration that specifies the access level (read/write) for the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> enumeration that specifies the data format of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData"></xref> that contains information about this lock operation.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> is not a specific bits-per-pixel value.
-or-
The incorrect <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> is passed in for a bitmap.
The operation failed.
Locks a <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> into system memory
Use the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.LockBits%2A> method to lock an existing bitmap in system memory so that it can be changed programmatically.

You can change the color of an image with the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.SetPixel%2A> method, although the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.LockBits%2A> method offers better performance for large-scale changes.
When calling this method, you should use a member of the <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat?displayProperty=fullName> enumeration that contains a specific bits-per-pixel (BPP) value.

Using <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat?displayProperty=fullName> values, such as <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Indexed> and <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Gdi>, will throw an <xref:System.ArgumentException?displayProperty=fullName>.
Also, passing the incorrect pixel format for a bitmap will throw an <xref:System.ArgumentException?displayProperty=fullName>.
This version of the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.LockBits%2A> method is intended to be used with a `flags` value of <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageLockMode?displayProperty=fullName>.
A rectangle structure that specifies the portion of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> to lock.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageLockMode"></xref> values that specifies the access level (read/write) for the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> values that specifies the data format of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData"></xref> that contains information about the lock operation.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData"></xref> that contains information about the lock operation.
<xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> value is not a specific bits-per-pixel value.
-or-
The incorrect <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat"></xref> is passed in for a bitmap.
The operation failed.
Makes the default transparent color transparent for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The system palette defines one color as the default transparent, or alpha, color.
This method makes the default transparent color transparent for this <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap>.
If no transparent color is specified by the system, <xref:System.Drawing.Color.LightGray%2A> is the transparent color.

When you call <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.MakeTransparent%2A>, the bitmap will be converted to the <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format32bppArgb> format, as this format supports an alpha channel.
The image format of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> is an icon format.
The operation failed.
Makes the specified color transparent for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.

When you call <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.MakeTransparent%2A>, the bitmap will be converted to the <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat.Format32bppArgb> format, as this format supports an alpha channel.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure that represents the color to make transparent.
The image format of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> is an icon format.
The operation failed.
Sets the color of the specified pixel in this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
Use <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.SetPixel%2A> method to set the color of an individual pixel in an image programmatically.
You can also change an image programmatically by using the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.LockBits%2A> method.
Typically for large-scale changes, the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap.LockBits%2A> method offers better performance.
The x-coordinate of the pixel to set.
The y-coordinate of the pixel to set.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure that represents the color to assign to the specified pixel.
The operation failed.
Sets the resolution for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
Use this method to set the desired resolution on a newly created bitmap.
Changing the resolution of the image does not change its physical size.
The horizontal resolution, in dots per inch, of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The vertical resolution, in dots per inch, of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref>.
The operation failed.
Unlocks this <xref href="System.Drawing.Bitmap"></xref> from system memory.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData> specifies the attributes of the <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap>, such as size, pixel format, the starting address of the pixel data in memory, and length of each scan line (stride).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData"></xref> that specifies information about the lock operation.
The operation failed.
